page.title: 01LANDSCAPE
page.content:
This is a particularly peaceful,green, undulating, area, generously endowed with a variety of trees, both coniferous and deciduous.It is sprinkled with mainly stone houses, many of great age and mostly connected with farming, with which the region is associated.
The {River Ure}enters from the north-{ west and meanders its steeply-banked way in a south-easterly direction, cutting the land in two separate parts.
To the east lie the villages of {Thornton Watlass, Thirn,}and{Clifton- {on-Ure},in descending order of size. To the west is the hamlet of{Low {Ellington.}There is no bridging point between.
